data.title: Great tea and gluten free deserts!
data.text: I love this eclectic out of the way tea room. They have some exotic blends and they work hard to find the right tea for you! The staff is very knowledgeable and attentive, especially for what is essentially a coffee shop that serves tea instead of coffee. The limited menu is healthy and tasty! The outdoor porch is a great place to relax or read while you enjoy your tea. It is small space and usually busy at lunch time!

data.title: Epic Tea !
data.text: OK its just tea...but the selection is fantastic, it is brewed to order, they have great snacks and desserts, and the staff is terrific !  Internet and comfotable nooks for seating.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text:
Was brought to this place by a friend and wow. The tea was fantastic. The food was fantastic. The feel and vibe? Fantastic. There used to be a place similar to this in West Palm and I'm so glad that there is finally another great little tea house. 

The teas decorate the wall and walking in is like walking into a candy shop. Yes, it's a bit overwhelming with so many choices. But with the help of the staff, they make choosing the perfect tea incredibly easy. The food was also fantastic. Gluten free and vegan options also available, is that's your thing.

All in all, the Yaxche Tearoom is definitely worth visiting whether you're a local looking for something new and exciting or on vacation and looking to get a taste of Delray.

data.title: SomeTibetan decor with your tea
data.text: It's small and colorful, set in a grove of bamboo and other large tropical plants, just off Delray Beach's main drag, Atlantic Avenue.  It has countless teas that can be made to order, hot or cold.  It has delicious salads and many vegan desserts.  It's got gift stuff.  It's like being in Berkeley in the 60s, except pricier.  Staff are attentive. Ambience is multicolored Buddhist, with lots of comfortable couches and chairs.  We came upon it by accident and are so glad we found it.
